headline: Instant Pot Baked Beans
description: This Instant Pot baked beans recipe is an old family favorite transformed into a much quicker Instant Pot recipe without needing to soak the beans.
name: Instant Pot Baked Beans
recipeIngredient: 1 pound dry navy beans, rinsed and picked through
6 ounces bacon, cut into small pieces

recipeInstructions.text: Combine water and beans in a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as an Instant Pot). Close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set the timer for 15 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.

Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 20 minutes; quick-release remaining pressure according to manufacturer's directions. Unlock and remove the lid. Drain and rinse beans with cold water and set aside. Rinse and wipe out the Instant Pot insert and place back into the pressure cooker.

Turn on the Instant Pot and select the Sauté function. Heat olive oil until shimmering, 2 to 3 minutes. Add salt pork, bacon, and onion; cook until fat begins to render, 1 to 2 minutes. Pour in 1/2 cup water and scrape any browned bits off the bottom. Turn the Instant Pot off.

Whisk together molasses, ketchup, brown sugar, mustard, and remaining 1 cup water in a small bowl. Return cooked beans to the pot along with ketchup mixture. Gently stir to combine. Close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set the timer for 35 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.

Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 20 minutes; quick-release remaining pressure according to manufacturer's directions. Unlock and remove the lid. Beans will thicken as they cool. Serve immediately or freeze portions for later.

review.reviewBody: I used a full 9 oz of ham instead of salt pork to make it a bit meatier. I did end up using a 50/50 mix of navy beans and small red beans for added color and a more subtle flavor blend. It is just a bit sweeter than I would like but is excellent just as is.
Making for second time today. It was a great hit with everyone! I am also increasing sauce for more creaminess. The flavor is wonderful. Thanks so much for sharing.

I changed nothing and make it 2-3 times per month. My only issue is sometimes, every third time or so, my instant pot sceams "BURN" on it and sets me back awhile. I have to cool it down and scrape the bottom and re-cook it. No website advice helps and I'm sure not going to throw it out! Those times it can taste a little bit burnt but I don't mind, it is still better than $3/can Bush's. Over rice or on toast it is delicious!
Double the sauce, use a medium onion, half ketchup, half barbecue sauce. If using a slow cooker, soak the beans overnight , parboil in the morning, and slow cook all day.
This came out so good. Sweet, savory, and delicious. Not difficult to make but I may try bigger beans next time.
Used pork belly instead of salt pork and added a bit more molasses
My family loved it. Quick and easy.
delicious! this will be my go to recipe from now on. I made it as is, no changes
First try at *any* from-scratch baked bean recipe. Used Publix' small red beans. Doubled sauciness (thanks, prior reviewers). Partner and I won't be going back to canned.
Great recipe. I doubled the sauce and it was perfect
Followed the receipe exactly and within 10 min the burn alarm came on the instapot. Turned off the instapot and placed beans in the oven to finish. Disappointed in receipe.

I’ve been trying for ages to recreate my Nana’s FrenchCanadian baked beans, and this is it!!! I doubled the sauciness, did 8 oz of bacon, and 8 oz of diced ham. Thank you, thank you, thank you! The first bite nearly brought me to tears. I would hug you if I could.
Major family yummy, will be making again, an again, and again,.....
This was very easy to make although I will need to add to the cook time as the beans were a bit al dente. Overall, a very successful dish.

I had most of the ingredients, so I had a version without any of the meat. And I added a shot of liquid smoke and some honey.
Its a great recipe.
These beans came out wonderfully flavorful and some of the best beans we have had. They made our dinner delightful.

Exceptionally fantastic. The best baked bean recipe.
Thank you for posting it
Really good recipe. I added some hot pepper to give the beans more zip.

I have made this recipe a few times. It is absolutely delicious! I apologise for being 'that one person', but I never have fatback or salt port pork so I just add more bacon. Other than that, I make the recipe as written. Highly recommend!
Loved it! My beans cooked pretty well for the first 20 minutes so I simply changed the second cook time to 20 minutes instead of 35. turned out perfect! Will definitely make again.
I always use extra onions .This my classic recipe for a slow cooker ,now using the Ninja Foodi to cut time!

I JUST made this a day in advance for tomorrow's BBQ rib dinner. My beans were cooked after the first 20 minutes. So I cut the cooking time with the sauce down to 20 minutes and did auto release of pressure. (my beans must have been fresh because older beans take longer to took). This recipe is amazing! It reminds me of the beans my French Canadian mother made. Thank you so much.

Double the ketchup, molasses, mustard and bump the sugar up to 1/3C.
There are no brown bits when sautéing as the salt pork releases too much water but that's okay.
I trim the salt pork and serve the bacon on top after as I don't like mushy fat.
Best beans ever - I'm not fit to be around humans but that's a good thing right now :D
Even better the next day!

We’ll never buy a can of baked beans again. Excellent recipe as written. I’ve also subbed two diced hot dogs for the salt pork and bacon, in a pinch. Also like a splash of cider vinegar in with the liquids.
For the vegetarians....Beans were nice and tender! I doubled the sauce, and instead of bacon I added 1 1/2 teaspoons of smoked paprika and it came out great!

Very good recipe and so easy in the Instant Pot. I doubled the sauce ingredients as a couple of people suggested. Good suggestion. Unfortunately I also doubled the sugar. MISTAKE it was too sweet. I was able to save it by adding lime juice to cut the sweetness.
awesome... good suggestion to double the "sauciness"... I also cut sugar in half and added maple syrup
I like a smokier sauce, but this one was pretty good.
Excellent recipe. I used 4 assorted styles of beans and flavor of sauce was absolutely delicious. Saving this recipe for future events.

This was so easy to make compared to how I always do them. No soaking overnight. I started these the morning of the picnic and they were done early. I did double the sauce ingredients as suggested by some and was glad I did. I think it would be too dry if not doubled. The batch I made for the picnic all went and when I got home, I whipped up an batch and froze some of it. This is my new go to recipe for beans, without a doubt. These were a hit with everyone and I've given the recipe out to several people already. Thanks!

I thought this recipe was great. I was about to skip the salt pork, but glad that I made an effort to find it at the grocery store. Will make again for 3-day Holiday weekends with other summer BBQ favorites.
These beans are perfect! The first thing I made in the Instant pot
This was good. I did make some adjustments: Once I saw how low the sauce set, doubled sauce ingredients; and instead of the salted pork, used ground beef and halved the bacon.

Thanks for posting this recipe France C...! I made it once and am going to make it again, today, but however, since I am a diabetic, I use the basics in this recipe to cook the beans, then the sauce I use is G. Hughes sugar-free hickory smoked barbecue sauce for the flavor.
Trying to incorporate more beans into our diet and less meat. Found this to be good and hearty addition.
Very good baked beans and so much easier than using a slow cooker as I have for years. Will make again and freeze in serving size containers so I won;t have to buy any more canned beans.
My family absolutely loved it! The only change I will make next time is to add some tomato paste or sauce for a more tomato flavor.
